sentences.en: Against them, too, I must never relinquish control.
sentences.cn: 对它们, 我们永远不能放松警惕.

sentences.en: Article 52 The plaintiff may relinquish or modify his claims.
sentences.cn: 第五十二条原告可以放弃或者变更诉讼请求.

sentences.en: He did not relinquish his hold over Mary until his death.
sentences.cn: 直到他死去才放弃对玛丽的控制.

sentences.en: He was forced by law to relinquish the children to their mother.
sentences.cn: 按照法律,他被迫将孩子们让给了他们的母亲.

sentences.en: He was forced to relinquish control of the company.
sentences.cn: 他被迫放弃对公司的控制权。

sentences.en: He was forced to relinquish control of the company.
sentences.cn: 他被迫放弃公司的掌控权.

sentences.en: It is little to relinquish. What is it but a wilderness of misery and ruin?'
sentences.cn: 我放弃的东西很少, 除了一片痛苦与毁灭的荒原,还能有 什么 ? ”

sentences.en: It was doubtful whether Israel could be persuaded to relinquish its gains.
sentences.cn: 令人怀疑的是,能否说服以色列放弃其既得利益.

sentences.en: Libraries are powerless to relinquish them.
sentences.cn: 图书馆却无法弃而不用.

sentences.en: No one wants to relinquish power once they have it.
sentences.cn: 人一旦有了权就不想放弃。

sentences.en: Relinquish your grip on the rope -- you won't fall.
sentences.cn: 不用抓住绳索了, 你不会掉下去的!

sentences.en: They had to relinquish their position to the enemy.
sentences.cn: 他们只好把阵地放弃让于敌人.

sentences.en: They will never voluntarily relinquish their independence.
sentences.cn: 他们绝对不会自动放弃独立.

sentences.en: To lessen the pain, some people chose to relinquish all responsibility.
sentences.cn: 为了减少痛苦, 有些人选择放弃所有责任.

sentences.en: To relinquish ( power or responsibility ) formally.
sentences.cn: 正式放弃正式放弃 ( 权力或责任 )

sentences.en: Toyota's president Watanabe is expected to relinquish his job next year.
sentences.cn: 丰田汽车公司总裁渡边捷昭可能在明年卸任.

trans.tran_en: to let someone else have your position, power, or rights, especially unwillingly

trans.tran_cn: 放弃，让出（权利，财产等），放开，松手，撤离
